article.title: Defect reporting and tracking
article.label: Defect Tracking
article.intro: Learn more about our agile approach to defect tracking

text.p: A Defect is a non-conformance of [Deliverables]({% href process/warranty/deliverables %}) to [Specification]({% href process/scope/specification %}). Defects can be found by testers, project team members or you. No matter who identifies a Defect, it has to be removed.
Defects are stored in Defect Tracking System. Every customer will have access to this online system.
This is an example of properly reported Defect:
text.pre:
Visibility: high Repeatability: often
Platform: Windows XP Browser: MS IE 7.0 Defect: Being a registered user, I'm trying to change my personal avatar in my account. However, I can not upload TIFF file as avatar. Browser waits for 30 seconds then says that there is no reply from server. The same function works properly in FireFox and Opera. Reported: by Alex Date: 8-Jul
text.p: Properly reported Defects are easy to track, monitor and remove.

For each [Iteration]({% href process/time/iteration %}) we plan certain amount of Defects that may be found, and testers perform all necessary procedures to prepare for that amount of Defects. Test Plan is created by a test analyst at the beginning of each Iteration in the form of guidance for testers. Test Plan leads testers through product functionality and helps them to reveal the most critical Defects.

concepts.c1: Defect is the smallest element in the Cost Of Quality structure
concepts.c2: Iterative time management helps in effective identification and removal of Defects
concepts.c3: Specification is the only document describing the scope of the project
